classes.title: PERI710
classes.subtitle: Periodontal Therapy.  1 Credit.
classes.description: This graduate seminar reviews techniques and procedures for treating periodontal diseases. Topics include gingival grafting, surgical flap management, osseous surgery, periodontal regeneration, antimicrobials, host modulation, and periodontal medicine.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PERI711
classes.subtitle: Periodontal Therapy.  1 Credit.
classes.description: This graduate seminar reviews techniques and procedures for treating periodontal diseases. Topics include gingival grafting, surgical flap management, osseous surgery, periodontal regeneration, antimicrobials, host modulation, and periodontal medicine.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PERI711
classes.subtitle: Periodontal Therapy.  1 Credit.
classes.description: This graduate seminar reviews techniques and procedures for treating periodontal diseases. Topics include gingival grafting, surgical flap management, osseous surgery, periodontal regeneration, antimicrobials, host modulation, and periodontal medicine.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PERI721
classes.subtitle: Case Analysis.  2 Credits.
classes.description: This graduate seminar reviews techniques and procedures for treating periodontal diseases. Topics include gingival grafting, surgical flap management, osseous surgery, periodontal regeneration, antimicrobials, host modulation, and periodontal medicine.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PERI721
classes.subtitle: Case Analysis.  2 Credits.
classes.description: This graduate seminar continues themes introduced in PERI 720 and discusses advanced implant topics including bone augmentation, peri-implantitis, and implant efficacy assessment. The seminar includes didactic lectures, case presentations, and journal club components. Spring.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit. Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PERI723
classes.subtitle: Case Analysis.  2 Credits.
classes.description: This graduate seminar continues themes introduced in PERI 720 and discusses advanced implant topics including bone augmentation, peri-implantitis, and implant efficacy assessment. The seminar includes didactic lectures, case presentations, and journal club components. Spring.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit. Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PERI731
classes.subtitle: Seminar in Periodontology.  2 Credits.
classes.description: In this first-year literature review course, graduate students present and evaluate the evidence on periodontal disease etiology, pathogenesis, risk factors and treatments including mechanical, surgical, and pharmacological approaches.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit. Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PERI761
classes.subtitle: Seminar in Periodontology.  2 Credits.
classes.description: In this first-year literature review course, graduate students present and evaluate the evidence on periodontal disease etiology, pathogenesis, risk factors and treatments including mechanical, surgical, and pharmacological approaches.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit. Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PERI761
classes.subtitle: Seminar in Periodontology.  2 Credits.
classes.description: In this second- and third-year literature review course, graduate students discuss evidence on advanced topics in periodontology or related disciplines.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit. Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PERI762
classes.subtitle: Seminar in Dental Implantology.  1 Credit.
classes.description: In this second- and third-year literature review course, graduate students discuss evidence on advanced topics in periodontology or related disciplines.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit. Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PERI762
classes.subtitle: Seminar in Dental Implantology.  1 Credit.
classes.description: In this literature review course, graduate students will discuss evidence on dental implant and other related therapies.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PERI820
classes.subtitle: Introduction to Implants.  1 Credit.
classes.description: In this literature review course, graduate students will discuss evidence on dental implant and other related therapies.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PERI820
classes.subtitle: Introduction to Implants.  1 Credit.
classes.description: This graduate seminar traces the biology of osseointegration, surgical techniques in dental implant placement, and prosthetic restoration. The seminar includes didactic lectures, case presentations, and journal club components.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit. Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PERI821
classes.subtitle: Clinical Implantology.  1 Credit.
classes.description: This graduate seminar traces the biology of osseointegration, surgical techniques in dental implant placement, and prosthetic restoration. The seminar includes didactic lectures, case presentations, and journal club components.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit. Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PERI821
classes.subtitle: Clinical Implantology.  1 Credit.
classes.description: This graduate seminar continues themes introduced in PERI�820 and discusses advanced implant topics including bone augmentation, peri-implantitis, and implant efficacy assessment. The seminar includes didactic lectures, case presentations, and journal club components.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PERI891
classes.subtitle: Advanced Clinical Periodontics and Clinical Practice.  2-6 Credits.
classes.description: This graduate seminar continues themes introduced in PERI�820 and discusses advanced implant topics including bone augmentation, peri-implantitis, and implant efficacy assessment. The seminar includes didactic lectures, case presentations, and journal club components.Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PERI891
classes.subtitle: Advanced Clinical Periodontics and Clinical Practice.  2-6 Credits.
classes.description: Within this specialty clinic, graduate students gain experience and competency in diagnosing and comprehensively treating patients with periodontal diseases. Cases may involve interdisciplinary care, medical management, dental implants, and sedation procedures.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit. Grading status: Letter grade.

classes.title: PERI993
classes.subtitle: Master's Research and Thesis.  3 Credits.
classes.description: Within this specialty clinic, graduate students gain experience and competency in diagnosing and comprehensively treating patients with periodontal diseases. Cases may involve interdisciplinary care, medical management, dental implants, and sedation procedures.Repeat rules: May be repeated for credit. Grading status: Letter grade.
